column1: If the opposite of pro is con.. whats the opposite of progress?
column3: In this context, progress refers to advancement or improvement, and progress can also refer to a specific step taken in a procedure or action.
column4: The teams progress on the project was commendable.
column5: The progress of the meeting was hindered by unforeseen delays.

column1: I say, this bloody coffee tastes like mud!.... it should sir, it was ground this morning.
column3: Ground refers to a surface or area of land, and ground can also mean to crush into small particles, as in coffee grounds.
column4: The ground is covered with snow during winter.
column5: The beans were ground to prepare fresh coffee.

column1: I dont date left handed chicks cause you know, lefty loosey righty tighty.
column3: Left refers to the direction opposite of right, and left can also denote something that has been abandoned or remains.
column4: He turned left at the intersection.
column5: All the leftover food was put in the fridge.

column1: How can you get a set of teeth put in for free? smack a monster.
column3: Set can refer to a collection or group, and set can also refer to the act of placing something in a specific location.
column4: She bought a new set of dishes for her kitchen.
column5: Please set the books on the shelf.

column1: A hurricane is going to hit the east coast? are you joaquin?
column3: Hit can mean to strike someone or something, and hit can also refer to an occurrence of an event.
column4: He decided to hit the ball over the fence.
column5: The movie was a big hit at the box office.
